name: Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using the latest and complete set of drawings
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activities
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP.
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - Site and office Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Materials and equipment that shall be used in the construction of the works as nominated on the Drawings.

○ The Contractor shall survey the proposed light locations in conjunction with the new and existing line-marking to set out the proposed lights. A schedule of the proposed lights shall be produced and submitted to the Contract Administrator.
○ The initial installation of the light base shall be witnessed by the Contractor Administrator
Record of conformity - This ITP Signed
2.1 - Steel Reinforcement Mesh and Reo Cage
Acceptance Criteria - N12-150 steel mesh installed on both direction with 43.5mm cover.
○ N12 reinforcement cage to be installed as per AGL details
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Avionics Base Canister Installation ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete encasement for electrical conduit shall have a minimum cover of 40mm.
– Ensure bottom of can is 200mm minimum to the bottom of foundation.
– Compressive Strength Test Sample to be conducted per 50 m3 of concrete
– Install 19mm plywood cover with mud plate (sealed and bolts torqued to 40NM)
– Check the elevation (RL) of the bottom canister (top plate) relative to the FSL of PCC concrete.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Avionics Base Canister Installation ITC, Concrete Test Results
Acceptance Criteria - Core pilot hole (150mm) down to target ring and establish exact centre.
– Install top canister with spacer rings and dam rings
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Avionics Top Canister Installation ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Install bolts and tightened to manufacturer’s recommended torque using a calibrated torque wrench.
– Apply Webertec FG epoxy sealant to the void between housing and side of excavation
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Avionics Top Canister Installation ITC
Acceptance Criteria - Installed and backfill in accordance with drawings.
– Two piece deep base cans to be installed.
– Min. 500mm cover from finished surface to top of conduit.
– Can fitted with frangible coupling and FAA type/secondary socket retaining arrangement plug and socket.
– Foundation and reinforcement installation to match Deep Can Installation for Rigid Pavement
Record of conformity - This ITP signed, Avionics Base Canister Installation Checklist
